alert.note: Alert for Colleton; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 31 at 12:49AM EDT until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Colleton and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1245 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated very light rain moving across northern Colleton County along the backside of Tropical Storm Idalia. While additional flooding is unlikely, flooding continues in many areas. Never drive into areas where waters covers the road. - Water rises along Ireland Creek are slowing and should remain below levels that cause flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Colleton, Cottageville, Smoaks, Lodge, Williams, Ruffin, Padgetts, Islandton, Canadys, Ashton, Round O, Smyly, Stokes, Bells Crossroads, Rhodes Crossroads, Colleton Medical Center, Caldwell, Lowcountry Regional Airport and Springtown.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
